Does anyone have a katana saya with a groove that they can post a 
picture of to group? I'm sure Steve is quite correct, as his 
expertise is fittings and he probably has examples in his museum.

Wouldn't it also depend on what side you carried the dasiho on? 
Wasn't it considered a grave insult in some situations for a samurai 
to carry the dasiho on his left side?

Peter

--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Mark Sala" <franzkafka19@m...> 
wrote:
> No, I have not seen it yet. Mark. :-)
> 
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Tom Helm
> Sent: Monday, April 19, 2004 11:35 PM
> To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Wakizashi Help
> 
> 
> On Apr 18, 2004, at 12:34 AM, Peter Farrar wrote:
> 
> > Tom,
> >
> >  Steve said that the katana would have a groove on the saya that 
would 
> > hold
> >  it tight against the bevel on the wakizashi so that the two 
would 
> > almost
> >  lock together. He said the bevel is fairly common on daisho wak 
> > saya's.
> >
> >
> 
> Steve-
>       I don't mean to be obtuse but wouldn't the groove be on the 
outside 
> (omote) of the Wakizashi saya where the contact with the Katana 
saya 
> would be? Anyone else on the list seen a bevel on a daisho 
koshirae?
> -t
